html:
4.15.24  8:45 pm   Which sports team's logo is your favorite?

      the tradertown teamswitchers

4.15.24  7:21 pm   how do you play so fast without even trying

      probably similar to how you can talk or write as fast as you do, without trying

4.15.24  7:18 pm   Have you ever asked a question on this website?

      no

4.15.24  6:45 pm   do you like grilled cheese sandwiches

      from an artistic standpoint, yes

4.15.24  6:09 pm   how do you get to where you need to be?

      with movement

4.15.24  5:43 pm   can you help me with my homework

      probably not

4.15.24  3:54 pm   how many questions are there

      a couple

4.15.24  1:37 pm   would you like some advice

      sure

4.15.24  1:16 pm   If you went to the bank but instead of giving you money they gave you wisdom what would you do with that newfound experience?

      invest it

4.15.24  12:50 pm   favorite type of bread

      baguette

4.15.24  12:38 pm   favorite chord of the moment?

      F

4.15.24  11:50 am   What is life?

      movement

4.15.24  11:18 am   you know how Nudibranches (Nu-Dee-br-anks)  or
as they are commonly called, sea slugs, have many colors and patterns (at least you do now) do you have a favorite color + pattern combo for them, or any other animal for that matter?

      absolutely not

4.15.24  11:13 am   Why am i expected to do things?

      maybe you have formed a predictable pattern of things you've done in the past, leading to an obvious expectation. either that or someone has ignored your past behavior entirely and is expecting something unlikely from you instead

4.15.24  10:29 am   Why is most pop music about love?

      just crunching the numbers here, it appears love is popular

4.15.24  10:10 am   what did you think of feel about the eclipse?

      beautiful clear dim day

4.15.24  9:48 am   what inspired you to write "and the day goes on" is there any deeper meaning other than the world still moving on regardless of what happens (or did I get that meaning wrong too)

      with music, i'm able to get a much greater depth of emotion than just stating any of those things with words alone. this is true with any song or music. so indeed it's way deeper than what you said, because you said it without using any music

4.15.24  9:29 am   What's the best thing to do at any moment?

      everything

4.15.24  8:24 am   have u ever dream of homosexual cyborg ducks of questionable sex that are assasins and that take overthe omni verse with their cybernetic gayness??

      no

4.15.24  7:43 am   Do you have anything against genres?

      sure, when the genre comes before the music, that seems a little fake for me

4.15.24  7:22 am   do you have any favorites in your discography? least favorites?

      no

4.15.24  5:36 am   Can I have some cake?

      sure

4.15.24  1:42 am   who would win in a fight, a spider crab or a lobster? would it depend on the arena being underwater or overwater? what if it was in space?

      it goes different each time

4.15.24  1:09 am   favorite chord of the day?

      i need to switch chords more than once per day

4.15.24  12:17 am   How do I make music with no past experience making music

      no one else knows that, except you. especially in this case, because no one has ever heard you do it before

4.14.24  11:24 pm   what was your thought process when you were making "i'm a princess" and what's the message in this song. it's one of my top 5 favorite songs you've made and im really curious about how you came up with the lyrics

      instead of a thought process, it's a feels process, and instead of coming up with 'lyrics', i come up with the whole relationship between the words and the music all at once. that's just my standard procedure

4.14.24  10:47 pm   you know that thing where tons of people think modern music sucks because they only remember the really good stuff from a long time ago? well, i feel the same thing about my own (as of yet unrecorded) song ideas (and on a much shorter timescale - ie a year or so). i feel like a disproportionate amount of my new song ideas are just boring and dead feeling, or just overall super uncreative, and it's a shitty feeling, especially when i look back fondly at ideas from a year or 2 ago. i'm wondering, have you ever experienced this with your own song ideas? any thoughts on the matter? thanks

      what might happen is this: some time later from now, you may look back upon this current moment with fondness also. then hopefully you'll see some evidence that almost anything can look better when it's in the past. but if you want to amplify this effect even more, do something brand new

4.14.24  8:00 pm   how come there are barely any sus4/sus2 chords in the real book, is it that those songs didnt have them, or that whoever transcribed them favored other chords?

      those songs didn't really use them

4.14.24  5:19 pm   whats the funniest thing you have ever heard in your life

      if i knew how to quantify that then it would not be funny. for example, a non-funny thing is sometimes the most funny, especially in situations where funny things were expected

4.14.24  1:48 pm   why do i have the urge to write about myself in a bad way to serve as an apology after seeing you answer one of my questions in such an insightful way

      i'm not quite sure. but you can try it and see if it helps

4.14.24  11:37 am   do you like pancakes sir?

      almost

4.14.24  8:32 am   Can you give us a good reason as to why one should go to the castle?

      to find out why you went to it

4.14.24  6:05 am   what do you think about black holes

      actually surprisingly white

4.14.24  4:11 am   Is an arpeggio a chord?

      it's a non-chord way of saying what a chord is. like, is "W. O. R. D." a word? no, that just spells a word

4.14.24  1:48 am   what font is this?

      none

4.14.24  1:11 am   would you ever stage dive

      no

4.14.24  12:36 am   how to be more open-minded

      did you try turning it off and on again

4.14.24  12:28 am   I'M A LOBSTER 

      i understand

4.13.24  11:24 pm   what's the deal with atonal music

      i'm not sure. all the times i think i've found atonal music, someone advises me "no, this is still tonal. real atonal music has to be even less tonal than that", so i don't know. a pile of leaves i assume has to be atonal, for sure

4.13.24  11:16 pm   how do you write a definition for a theoretically invisible term in music theory

      you may have to use metaphors

4.13.24  9:57 pm   if you could send one object back in time to alter history the most what object are sending back and to what period of time? 

      how about a calendar, set to today's date, sent back to 100 years in the past

4.13.24  8:21 pm   How do you have so much going on in your songs without it sounding cluttered or the mix sounding muddy?

      the trick is to have actually not very many things ever sounding at the exact same time. like 2 things at most, per instant

4.13.24  7:46 pm   Do you think being a huge gamer most of the time or a decent gamer all of the time is better?

      all i know is that i picked out the phrase 'huge gamer most of the time' because it had a nice ring to it, or at least i thought so at the time. that's all i know about this matter

4.13.24  6:10 pm   how do you go about making different parts of a song sound unique? mine have been very bland

      sometimes what it takes is, to dare to make part of it bad on purpose. we get so hung up on trying to make it as good as we can, naturally that's gonna make the whole thing have that same do-gooder sound, the sound of you trying to do good. so that leaves you with only one way to change that, really, which is turn it into crap suddenly. easier said than done, i realize

4.13.24  5:57 pm   I enjoy listening to your music a lot. It's everything at once, which makes it always great. Does it feel good or relieving to create it, or do you create it for other reasons?

      typically if i come up with something i like, i'm bouncing off the walls. helemaal in de lucht springen

4.13.24  5:18 pm   have you ever grown, or considered growing, a beard?

      not really

4.13.24  4:43 pm   i'm trying to write a song, but i have a problem. the melody's normal range is from E4 to F#3 (with some E3), but i can't fit chords that don't distract me in the latter part of each phrase, where the melody drops below B3. is it just a problem with my synthesizer presets or something? 'cause i somehow don't like the sound of chords in the second octave

      it took me a long time reading this question to figure out what you are actually talking about. but now i think what you're saying is: this is a song that you intend to play all at once, just yourself, on just one instrument, and you've also promised yourself that the chords must always be lower than the melody, which would of course put the chords in the mud zone (too low to really ring as chords). although that seems kind of weird that you would assume that chords have to be below the melody so maybe i assumed wrong here. if you listen to almost any song with a male (man) singing, i think you'll find that the chords are very often higher than the vocal melody. but i'm really not sure if i interpreted your question right, because you didn't say anything about the chords being low, and i don't otherwise know why you'd think they should be

4.13.24  3:27 pm   what are your thoughts on college? or rather, people going to college as opposed to just getting a job straight out of high school

      i don't really know anything about college, what it is or how it works

4.13.24  2:38 pm   why did people used to state the key a composition was in in the title?

      probably just geeking out

4.13.24  1:53 pm   I hear you talking about chords all the time but I actually have no idea what a chord is. Can you please explain?

      it's when multiple notes are held at the exact same time
